DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient's disease responded to treatment during the indicated period.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The response of the patient's disease to treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease is any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function. (from Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Updated to add EVS concept preferred name. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.changeDescription: Denise Warzel updated Definition by seraching NCI Thesaurus in Admin tool.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk transferred context, updated case in defintion first word, and added registration status, CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not evaluable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Changed from CTEP to Alliance for by script Fri Oct 25 15:25:44 EDT 2013

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient's disease pro
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient's disease progress or relapse during the indicated period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If stable disease, did this constitute pseudo-progression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient's disease progress or relapse during this reporting period (intracranial disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have a definitive relapse this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant been diagnosed with progressive/recurrent disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience relapse or refractory disease during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient with disease progression at either the primary or pulmonary metastatic site while on initial therapy?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient with disease progression at either the primary or pulmonary metastatic site while on initial therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient develop disease progression at either the primary or pulmonary metastatic site while on initial therapy?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient develop disease progression at either the primary or pulmonary metastatic site while on initial therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop a relapse during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have imminent relapse during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient developed a definitive relapse that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop a definitive relapse during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a response to the previous infusion as indicated in the protocol?

DataElement.origin: NCISTD: NCI CRF Harmonization and Standards Initiative
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/30/17 New CDE to replace CDEs 2528349/3830556 per Round 5 finalization task; New VD to address removal of "Progressed" and "Relapsed" PVs which are captured in CDE 3830583.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.9.18 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002860. ak 2023.3.9 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak
